The file in eclipse\configuration\org.eclipse.osgi\.bundledata was corrupted. I 
deleted it and worked like a charm. Maybe putting the file with trouble in the 
log could help !

I cannot reproduce but even so this bug was not really addressed.  The runtime
could attempt to help the user fix the problem.

Renaming, but I thought that the .bundleData was being thrown away when there
was such a problem.
Has this been fixed with the new implementation of the fwk.

I have not been able to reproduce this on the latest builds.  We do additional 
checks now to ensure that the bundledata refers to valid bundles.  If the 
bundle is invalid then we toss the bundle.

Please reopen if you can reproduce on the latest 3.1 builds.
